statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Georgia 96, Gardner-Webb 67
article.story: ATHENS, Ga. (AP) -- Georgia built a big early lead with nine 3-pointers in the first half and power forward Takais Brown balanced the attack with 21 points to lead the Bulldogs past Gardner-Webb 96-67 on Tuesday night. Levi Stukes was 6-for-6 on 3-point shots and scored 20 points for Georgia. Mike Mercer scored 15 points and Steve Newman added 12 while making 3 of 4 3-pointers. Georgia (6-1) earned its fifth straight win, and Brown has scored in double figures as a reserve player in each of the five games. Brown (6-8, 250), a transfer from Southeastern Illinois College, played in only 21 minutes against Gardner-Webb, right on his average. Ricky McPhee, a former high school rival of Georgia's Mercer and Billy Humphrey in Gwinnett County, near Atlanta, and Chris Gash each had 12 points for Gardner-Webb. Gardner-Webb (1-6) was coming off its only win, over Ferrum, after an 0-5 start that included road losses to Texas Tech, North Carolina and North Carolina State. Georgia made 9 of 14 3-point shots to take a 48-28 halftime lead, and it led by more than 30 points much of the second half. Georgia shot 56.1 percent from the field and was 11 for 19 (57.9 percent) on 3-pointers.
